Reduced magnitude of bias in depressed patients correlates with reduced beta-specific effects. This suggests ACC beta oscillations orchestrate the learning of reward information to guide adaptive choice and may serve as a biomarker for anhedonia.
Gamma波特性: High gamma (60-140 Hz) power increases in the ACC (including BA24) have been observed following negative feedback (errors), suggesting a role in error processing and subsequent adjustments in cognitive control. Gamma activity in the ACC is also associated with higher-order cognitive functions and emotional regulation.
結合パターン: BA24 acts as a central hub, integrating cognitive-behavioral, emotional, and autonomic functions. It receives inputs from the orbitofrontal cortex and amygdala. It shows functional connectivity with the superior frontal gyrus (including BA8, BA10, BA32), temporal and parietal areas (e.g., subdivisions of BA7), and visual association areas (BA19). BA24 co-activates with the right postcentral gyrus (BA40) and supplementary motor area (SMA) during perceptual tasks. The subgenual ACC (sgACC), which includes parts of BA24/25, exhibits modulated connectivity with regions like the superior frontal gyrus, particularly in conditions such as depression.
臨床的意義: BA24, particularly the subgenual ACC (sgACC), is implicated in mood disorders, influencing emotional behavior and being associated with clinical depression and bipolar disorder. Changes in BA24 activity correlate with ketamine's antidepressant effects. Reduced beta-specific effects in BA24 are observed in depressed patients, potentially serving as a biomarker for anhedonia. Abnormalities in BA24 are associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder. It is a region of interest for pathology in Lewy Body Dementia (LBD) and Parkinson's Disease Dementia (PDD), and changes in cell densities have been observed in alcohol dependence. The ACC (including BA24) is a key cortical center for integrating pain with emotional and situational cues. Increased activity in BA24 has been linked to emotional regulation and stress management.

Subject: BA25
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 25 (BA25), also known as the subgenual area, area subgenualis, or subgenual cingulate area, is located in the cerebral cortex. It is delineated by cytoarchitectonic characteristics and situated in the cingulate region as a narrow band in the caudal portion of the subcallosal area, adjacent to the paraterminal gyrus. It is separated from the paraterminal gyrus by the posterior parolfactory sulcus and rostrally bounded by Brodmann Area 11.
主要機能: BA25 is extremely rich in serotonin transporters and acts as a governor for a vast network influencing appetite, sleep, mood, anxiety, memory formation, and self-esteem. It is particularly implicated in the normal processing of sadness.
Delta波特性: Specific characteristics or functional significance directly within BA25 were not found in the reviewed literature. Further targeted research would be needed to elucidate their role in this specific area.
Theta波特性: Increased low-theta power (4-7 Hz) in the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC), which includes BA25, has been shown to predict response to repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) in vascular depression. Normalization of higher than normal low-theta power in the subgenual ACC was observed after rTMS in responders. Low-theta power in the subgenual ACC was correlated to total HAM-D scores prior to rTMS.
Alpha波特性: Specific characteristics or functional significance directly within BA25 were not found in the reviewed literature. Further targeted research would be needed to elucidate their role in this specific area.
Beta波特性: Modulation of beta-band activity (14-30 Hz) in the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC), which includes BA25, has been observed during emotional empathy in treatment-resistant depression. Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) in sgACC influences beta activity, and a decrease in oscillatory beta activity (14-30 Hz) was observed in response to emotional stimuli in patients with treatment-resistant depression.
Gamma波特性: DBS for treatment-resistant depression has been shown to suppress frontal gamma oscillations (30-48 Hz / 36.5-44 Hz). Gamma oscillations are also observed in the subcallosal cingulate region (including BA25) and are implicated in various brain functions, though specific characteristics for BA25 are not extensively detailed in the context of normal function. Some studies mention gamma oscillations in the context of error processing in the anterior cingulate cortex (BA24, BA25, BA32).
結合パターン: BA25 acts as a governor for a vast network influencing appetite and sleep (via hypothalamus and brain stem), mood and anxiety (via amygdala and insula), memory formation (via hippocampus), and self-esteem (via parts of the frontal cortex). It is intrinsically functionally connected (with a negative correlation) with Brodmann Area 46.
臨床的意義: The subcallosal cingulate gyrus (CG25), encompassing BA25 and parts of BA24 and BA32, is significantly implicated in major depression. It is a target for deep brain stimulation (DBS) to treat treatment-resistant depression, where it is metabolically overactive. This hyperactivity is associated with poor therapeutic response to cognitive-behavioral therapy and venlafaxine. DBS in BA25 has successfully treated severely depressed individuals. Neurofeedback targeting BA25 has shown significant reduction in depression symptoms. Transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) targeting BA46 (which has negative intrinsic functional connectivity with BA25) is more effective for depression. Responses of BA25 to sad stimuli are affected by cortisol, suggesting that hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis (HPA axis) dysregulation might contribute to depression-related changes in BA25 activity.

Subject: BA26
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 26 (ectosplenial area 26) is a cytoarchitecturally defined portion of the retrosplenial region of the cerebral cortex. It is a narrow band located in the isthmus of the cingulate gyrus, adjacent to the fasciolar gyrus internally. It is bounded externally by the granular retrolimbic area 29.
主要機能: Brodmann Area 26, as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), is primarily involved in spatial cognition. Its functions include spatial navigation, episodic memory, contextual learning and memory, and the consolidation and retrieval of spatial schemas. It also plays a role in landmark processing and path integration.
Delta波特性: Delta oscillations in the RSC have periods of Up and Down states and support memory consolidation. Enhancing delta oscillations (1-3 Hz) has been observed in the RSC.
Theta波特性: Theta power is significantly higher in the Retrosplenial Cortex (RSC) during paradoxical sleep (PS) compared to active waking. RSC neurons display enhanced spiking in synchrony with theta specifically during PS. Neuronal discharge of RSC neurons increases just after the peak of the hippocampal theta wave.
Alpha波特性: The retrosplenial cortex responds with greater magnitude alpha oscillations (10-15 Hz) during retrieval of old memories in macaques. Studies also show dominant perturbations in the alpha band in the retrosplenial complex during spatial navigation.
Beta波特性: Beta bursting has been detected in the retrosplenial cortex, increasing in prevalence during contextual novelty. Transient cortical beta-frequency oscillations are associated with specific cognitive processes. Beta bursting in the RSC is synchronous with the hippocampus and is upregulated during memory retrieval of old memories. Beta oscillations in the RSC play a significant role in spatial learning and memory and are functionally disrupted in early Alzheimer's disease.
Gamma波特性: Phase-amplitude coupling between hippocampal theta and gamma oscillations strongly and specifically increases in the RSC during PS compared with active waking. The granular retrosplenial cortex (gRSC) layer 2/3 generates high-frequency oscillations (HFOs; ~150 Hz), which can be driven by a hippocampus-subiculum pathway. These HFOs can be coupled with hippocampal theta and gamma in online states. Low-gamma and high-gamma oscillations are also observed in the retrosplenial local field potentials (LFP).
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 26, as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), is a secondary association cortex with extensive connections. It has reciprocal connections with the anterior cingulate cortex (ACA) and also connects with anterior thalamic nuclei and the entorhinal cortex. The RSC serves as an interface between anterior thalamic nuclei, entorhinal cortex, and other cortical and medial temporal lobe (MTL) regions. It is considered a memory gateway, facilitating communication between cortical default mode network (DMN) regions and the MTL.
臨床的意義: Brodmann Area 26, as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), is one of the first brain regions to exhibit pathological changes in Alzheimer's disease and its prodromal phase, mild cognitive impairment. Intracellular pathological changes have been observed in the RSC of individuals with dementia. Structural and functional alterations within the RSC are linked to various neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric disorders.

Subject: BA27
解剖学的位置: 側頭葉の海馬傍回吻側部に位置し、プレサブキュラム（presubiculum）として知られています。その背側部はポストサブキュラム（postsubiculum）とも呼ばれます。海馬傍回形成の一部を構成し、サブキュラムと内側嗅内皮質（entorhinal cortex）の間の移行領域です。
主要機能: BA27、特にその背側部であるポストサブキュラムは、**空間認知**と**ナビゲーション**において重要な役割を果たします。これは、動物の頭部が特定の方向を向いたときに選択的に発火する**頭部方向細胞**の存在に主に起因します。また、**シーンベースの認知**や空間表現にも関与しています。一部の文献ではBA27を嗅覚に関連する梨状皮質と同一視していますが、ブロードマン領域および海馬形成の文脈では、空間処理における役割がより一般的です。
Delta波特性: 直接的な言及は見られませんでした。
Theta波特性: てんかんラットにおける研究では、プレサブキュラム刺激後に内側嗅内皮質（MEA）の深層および歯状回でシータ波帯域のより遅い振動が時折観察されました。これは病理学的状態に関連する可能性があります。正常な活動における直接的な言及は見られませんでした。
Alpha波特性: 直接的な言及は見られませんでしたが、空間認知に関連する脳活動においてアルファ波の変調が示唆される可能性があります。
Beta波特性: てんかんラットにおける研究では、プレサブキュラム刺激後に内側嗅内皮質（MEA）の表層で20-45Hzの振動が観察され、これはベータ波帯域に該当します。これは病理学的状態に関連する可能性があります。
Gamma波特性: てんかんラットにおける研究では、プレサブキュラム刺激後に内側嗅内皮質（MEA）の表層で20-45Hzの振動が観察され、これは低ガンマ波帯域に該当します。これは病理学的状態に関連する可能性があります。
結合パターン: 海馬形成および関連構造と密接に結合しています。内側嗅内皮質（MEA）の特に第III層に投射し、MEA表層の抑制性介在ニューロンにも入力します。ポストサブキュラムは海馬形成への入力構造と見なされ、嗅内皮質に情報を中継します。海馬形成および帯状回皮質から主要な投射を受けます。また、頭部方向細胞信号の処理に関与し、前背側視床核との結合も確立されています。
臨床的意義: BA27はアルツハイマー病（AD）とてんかんにおいて臨床的意義が示唆されています。ADにおいては、他の海馬領域と比較して神経変性変化やアミロイド/タウ病理から比較的保護されているという報告がある一方で、穿通路投射の減少やシナプス統合の障害により体積変化が生じ、初期のアミロイドおよびタウ病理と関連する可能性も指摘されています。てんかんにおいては、プレサブキュラム刺激後に内側嗅内皮質で異常な20-45Hzおよびシータ波帯域の振動が観察されており、側頭葉における発作発生または伝播への関与が示唆されています。ポストサブキュラムの病変は、視覚的および非視覚的空間学習の障害を引き起こすことも示されています。

Subject: BA28
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 28 (BA28), also known as the area entorhinalis ventralis, is a subdivision of the cerebral cortex located on the medial aspect of the temporal lobe and constitutes a significant part of the entorhinal cortex (EC) [1, 2, 3]. In humans, BA28, along with Brodmann Area 34, collectively forms the entorhinal cortex [1]. It is situated in the mesial temporal lobe and serves as a crucial interface between the hippocampus and the neocortex [3]. Anatomically, it occupies the middle portion of the medial temporal region, including parts of the parahippocampal gyrus and gyrus ambiens [3]. Its boundaries are defined by the rhinal sulcus (anteriorly), the collateral sulcus (laterally), and it merges with the hippocampal formation (dorsomedially) [3]. The EC is organized into six layers, with distinctive features in BA28 including an unusually wide molecular layer (I), an external granular layer (II) containing nests of multipolar cells, and the absence of an internal granular layer (IV) [1]. It is further subdivided into lateral entorhinal cortex (LEC) and medial entorhinal cortex (MEC) [4].
主要機能: BA28, as part of the entorhinal cortex, plays a pivotal role in memory formation, spatial navigation, and sensory processing [2, 4]. It is essential for forming memories, acting as the primary pathway for sensory information to the hippocampal formation [2, 4]. The LEC is involved in object and contextual memory, while the MEC is specialized for spatial memory [4]. The MEC contains specialized neurons crucial for spatial representation and navigation, including grid cells, head direction cells, border cells, and conjunctive cells [4]. BA28 is also involved in processing the sense of smell, and lesions here can manifest as olfactory hallucinations [5]. It supports working memory, particularly in visuospatial tasks, and contributes to temporal association memory [4].
Delta波特性: Delta waves (0.5-4Hz) are typically associated with deep sleep and certain pathological conditions. Independent delta rhythms have been observed in the entorhinal cortex [6]. Increased delta power can be localized in brain regions corresponding to Brodmann areas during certain cognitive conditions [7].
Theta波特性: Theta waves (4-8Hz) activity in the entorhinal cortex is strongly linked to memory processes and spatial navigation [4, 6]. It is particularly involved in day-dreaming and memory encoding [8]. Theta oscillations are a prominent feature of the entorhinal cortex, often seen in conjunction with gamma oscillations [9, 10]. Theta-burst microstimulation of the EC can enhance recognition memory [4].
Alpha波特性: Alpha waves are generally associated with a relaxed, wakeful state. While not specifically detailed for BA28, alpha waves are known to be related to behavioral inhibition and can be influenced by neurofeedback training [11, 12].
Beta波特性: Beta waves are typically associated with active thinking, alertness, and concentration. The entorhinal cortex's activity contributes to overall brain states, but specific beta characteristics for BA28 are not distinctly highlighted in the provided sources.
Gamma波特性: Gamma oscillations (30-100Hz+) are observed in the entorhinal cortex, often in association with theta rhythms, and are implicated in cognitive function and information processing [4, 9, 10]. Slow gamma stimulation may impair memory encoding [4].
結合パターン: BA28, as the entorhinal cortex, is a major hub for information flow within the limbic system, particularly with the hippocampus and neocortex [3, 4]. It has intrinsic connectivity organized into three rostrocaudal bands (lateral, intermediate, medial) with strong interconnections within each band [4]. It receives afferent inputs from the perirhinal, postrhinal, and parahippocampal cortices, amygdala, thalamus, and olfactory structures, with the amygdala preferentially targeting the lateral EC [4]. It sends efferent projections to all hippocampal subfields (dentate gyrus, CA3, CA2, CA1, subiculum). Layer II neurons project radially, and layer III neurons project transversely. The lateral EC also sends efferents to subcortical structures like the amygdala, olfactory nuclei, and basal ganglia [4]. The hippocampal-entorhinal circuit is fundamental for episodic memory formation and consolidation [13]. Fiber density between the rhinal cortex (including BA28) and activated ventrolateral prefrontal regions predicts episodic memory performance [3].
臨床的意義: The entorhinal cortex (BA28) is notably vulnerable in several neurological and psychiatric disorders. In Alzheimer’s Disease (AD), Layer II neurons in the EC are among the earliest affected, with neurofibrillary tangles (NFTs) and tau pathology appearing decades before amyloid-beta (Aβ) deposition. Approximately 30% of EC neurons are lost by the mild cognitive impairment stage, and EC atrophy is a reliable biomarker for disease progression [4]. In Temporal Lobe Epilepsy, the EC exhibits hyperexcitability and interneuron loss, especially in layer III of the medial EC, contributing to seizure generation and propagation. Surgical removal of the EC is often necessary to control drug-resistant limbic seizures [4]. In Schizophrenia and Bipolar Disorder, neuronal migration disturbances, including disorganized and displaced layer II neurons, are observed in schizophrenia. Reduced densities of parvalbumin-positive interneurons and decreased microtubule-associated protein expression have been reported in both disorders, suggesting early neurodevelopmental disruptions affecting EC connectivity [4].

Subject: BA29
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 29 (BA29), also known as the granular retrolimbic area 29 or granular retrosplenial cortex, is a narrow band located in the isthmus of the cingulate gyrus. Cytoarchitecturally, it is bounded internally by the ectosplenial area 26 and externally by the agranular retrolimbic area 30. It is part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), specifically the granular area (RSCg) in the ventral region.
主要機能: Brodmann Area 29, as part of the retrosplenial and posterior cingulate cortex, is primarily involved in memory, navigation, and is a component of the brain’s default mode network. Its functions extend beyond location and orientation-related coding in navigation, encompassing mnemonic processing (encoding and retrieval of sequence-based or episodic memories). It plays a role in integrating diverse inputs, shifting and relating perspectives for spatial cognition, and prediction and error correction for current sensory states with internal representations of the environment. These functions contribute to intelligent actions such as navigation, perspective-taking, interaction with others, and error detection.
Delta波特性: Specific information on delta wave characteristics for BA29 is not explicitly detailed in the provided sources, but general EEG correlates of spatial orientation and network changes during seizures have been noted in the retrosplenial complex.
Theta波特性: Human RSC intracranial EEG power fluctuations in the theta bands have been observed across various tasks, including autobiographical memory, arithmetic, and non-episodic self-referential declarative memory. Theta-phase synchrony has been reported between RSC/posteromedial and MTL areas. In humans, slower 1-5 Hz theta (outside the traditional 4-8 Hz cutoff) has been compared with higher 4-12 Hz theta observed in rodents. The theta rhythm is linked to mechanisms supporting neural plasticity in the hippocampus, with peaks and troughs associated with synaptic potentiation and depression, respectively. RSC spiking and locally generated gamma activity follow similar hippocampal activity patterns within theta cycles.
Alpha波特性: Specific information on alpha wave characteristics for BA29 is not explicitly detailed in the provided sources, but general EEG correlates of spatial orientation and network changes during seizures have been noted in the retrosplenial complex.
Beta波特性: Specific information on beta wave characteristics for BA29 is not explicitly detailed in the provided sources, but general EEG correlates of spatial orientation and network changes during seizures have been noted in the retrosplenial complex.
Gamma波特性: Human RSC intracranial EEG power fluctuations in the high-gamma bands have been observed across various tasks, including autobiographical memory, arithmetic, and non-episodic self-referential declarative memory. Gamma rhythm patterning and peak spike probabilities in RSC follow corresponding CA1 dynamics, with distinct theta locations for peak low and high gamma amplitudes found at ascending and descending phases.
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 29, as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), is a major hub for interconnectivity among multiple cortical and subcortical brain regions. It has diverse afferent (input) and efferent (output) connections. Afferent sources include the anterior thalamus (ATN), latero-dorsal thalamus (LD), anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), orbitofrontal cortex (OFC), posterior parietal cortex (PPC), primary (V1) and higher-order visual cortices, claustrum (CLA), septal nucleus, subiculum (SUB), pre-subiculum (PrS), post-subiculum (PoS), parasubiculum (PaS), and post-rhinal cortex (PoR). Efferent targets include AT, PrS, PoS, PaS, SUB, medial entorhinal cortex (MEC), PPC, ACC, V1, CLA, and secondary motor cortex (M2). All subregions of the RSC are highly interconnected with each other.
臨床的意義: The retrosplenial cortex (including BA29) is implicated in various neurological and psychiatric disorders due to its role in memory, navigation, and the default mode network. Dysfunctions in RSC are associated with conditions affecting spatial memory, episodic memory, and self-referential processing. While specific clinical implications for BA29 are not fully detailed, its involvement in these critical functions suggests its relevance in understanding and potentially treating related disorders.

Subject: BA30
解剖学的位置: In the human, Brodmann Area 30 (BA30) is located in the isthmus of the cingulate gyrus. Cytoarchitecturally, it is bounded internally by the granular retrolimbic area 29, dorsally by the ventral posterior cingulate area 23, and ventrolaterally by the ectorhinal area 36.
主要機能: Brodmann Area 30, as part of the retrosplenial cortex, is involved in topographical orientation, including navigation in novel and familiar environments. It also plays a crucial role in higher-order cognitive functions like memory and attention.
Delta波特性: Delta waves (0.5-4Hz) in the retrosplenial cortex (including BA30) are involved in coordinating communications among cortical, hippocampal, and thalamic regions. They are critical for memory consolidation, with the retrosplenial cortex facilitating slow wave propagation to other brain regions. Delta waves are also an integral part of REM sleep.
Theta波特性: Theta waves (4-8Hz) in the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), which includes BA30, show significantly higher power during paradoxical sleep (PS, also known as REM sleep) compared to active waking. There is strong and specific phase-amplitude coupling between hippocampal theta and gamma oscillations in the RSC during PS. Neuronal discharge in the RSC increases just after the peak of hippocampal theta waves, indicating enhanced spiking in synchrony with theta during PS. Theta oscillations in the RSC are crucial for spatial memory and navigation, and are involved in hippocampal-dependent memory trace formation.
Alpha波特性: Alpha waves (8-13Hz) in the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), which includes BA30, are associated with relaxed wakefulness. Increasing retrosplenial alpha oscillation and decreasing hippocampocortical synchrony with memory age may signify a shift in memory processing. Alpha rhythms can act as an internal dynamic filter, adjusting in amplitude, phase, and frequency in response to cognitive demands, and are thought to have an inhibitory function, protecting new memories by inhibiting further sensory processing.
Beta波特性: Beta waves (13-30Hz) in the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), including BA30, are characterized by 'β Bursting'. These bursts are associated with increased neuronal spiking and are strongly upregulated during spatial learning and memory processes. Beta oscillations in the RSC play a significant role in the formation, recall, and consolidation of contextual memory, and are involved in distinguishing environmental context. They are also functionally disrupted in the early stages of Alzheimer's disease.
Gamma波特性: Gamma waves (30-100Hz+) in the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), including BA30, are involved in various cognitive processes. High-frequency oscillations (HFOs; ~150 Hz) are generated in granular retrosplenial cortex layer 2/3 and can be driven by a hippocampus-subiculum pathway. These HFOs are coupled with hippocampal theta and gamma oscillations in online states or sharp-wave ripples. Gamma rhythms in the RSC are also associated with rapid interhemispheric communication and coordinate information transfer between brain structures involved in memory. Phase-amplitude coupling between hippocampal theta and gamma oscillations strongly and specifically increases in the RSC during paradoxical sleep.
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 30 (BA30), as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), demonstrates projections to the mid-dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (Brodmann areas 46 and 9) and the thalamus. Approximately 20% of cortical inputs to the entorhinal cortex arise from the retrosplenial cortex. The RSC is heavily interconnected with an array of brain networks, both cortical and subcortical.
臨床的意義: Lesions to Brodmann Area 30 (BA30), as part of the retrosplenial cortex (RSC), lead to dysfunction in topographical orientation, including defective navigation in novel and familiar environments. The RSC is implicated in neuropsychiatric and neurodegenerative disorders. It is functionally disrupted in the early stages of Alzheimer's disease, with functional connectivity changes in BA30 observed in this condition. Changes in resting cerebral activities, including BA30, have also been noted in subacute ischemic stroke patients.

Subject: BA31
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 31, also known as dorsal posterior cingulate area 31, is a subdivision of the cytoarchitecturally defined cingulate region of the cerebral cortex. In the human, it occupies portions of the posterior cingulate gyrus and medial aspect of the parietal lobe. Approximate boundaries are the cingulate sulcus dorsally and the parieto-occipital sulcus caudally. It partially surrounds the subparietal sulcus, the ventral continuation of the cingulate sulcus in the parietal lobe. It is bounded rostrally by the ventral anterior cingulate area 24, ventrally by the ventral posterior cingulate area 23, dorsally by the gigantopyramidal area 4 and preparietal area 5 and caudally by the superior parietal area 7 (H) [3]. It is also described as the dorsal posterior cingulate cortex [4].
主要機能: Involved in self-referential thought, memory, and spatial awareness [9]. Also, signal extraction from background noise, and activated when familiar stimuli are encountered [10]. It plays a big role in emotion and memory, navigation, and the brain's default mode network [7].
Delta波特性: Significant activity in the PCC (including BA31) during eyes-closed state [1]. Deep brain activity in the PCC analyzed in this band [2].
Theta波特性: Significant activity in the PCC (including BA31) during eyes-closed state [1]. Deep brain activity in the PCC analyzed in this band [2].
Alpha波特性: Significant activity in the PCC (including BA31) during eyes-closed state [1, 2]. Deep brain activity in the PCC analyzed in this band [2].
Beta波特性: Significant activity in the PCC (including BA31) during eyes-closed state [1]. Elevated EEG functional connectivity in the beta-3 band (25-30 Hz) between PCC and sgPFC in remitted depressed patients [5].
Gamma波特性: Low gamma band activity in the PCC (including BA31) during eyes-closed state [1]. Stimulation of PCC impairs recall memory, with impairment predicted by stimulation-induced hippocampal gamma [8].
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 31 is part of the limbic system, playing a big role in emotion and memory. It is also part of the retrosplenial and posterior cingulate cortex, involved in memory, navigation, and the brain's default mode network [7].
臨床的意義: Dyslexics show main activity in Brodmann's area 31 (posterior cingulate cortex), while controls exhibit main activity in retrosplenial cortex (Brodmann's area 30). This suggests a role for the posterior cingulate cortex in the pre-attentive processing operation of dyslexia beyond its traditional function in terms of spatial attention and motor intention [6].

Subject: BA32
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 32 (BA32) は、ヒトの脳では背側前帯状野32として知られ、細胞構築学的に定義された帯状皮質の一部である。前帯状回を囲む外側の弧を形成する。帯状溝が内側の境界を、上吻側溝が腹側の境界をほぼ画定し、吻側では前頭葉の縁まで広がる。内部的には腹側前帯状野24、外部的には無顆粒前頭野6、中間前頭野8、顆粒前頭野9、前頭極野10、前頭前野11の各内側縁に接する。
主要機能: 背側前帯状回は、合理的な思考プロセス、特にストループ課題中に活発になることと関連している。記憶制御の必要性を検出し、不都合な内容に関する早期警告信号に積極的に反応する。
Delta波特性: デルタ波（0.5-4Hz）は、深い睡眠時に主に観察されるが、覚醒時の精神課題（計算、意味課題、Sternbergパラダイムなど）中に前頭部で増加することが報告されている。これは、課題遂行を妨げる干渉を抑制し、非活動であるべきネットワークの活動を調節することで、内部集中を助ける機能的皮質求心路遮断または抑制と関連している可能性がある。
Theta波特性: シータ波（4-8Hz）は、前帯状皮質（BA32を含む）において認知制御、課題ルール、および注意と関連している。特に、ACCの神経回路におけるリズミカルなシータ帯域活動が認知制御の核心的側面を符号化することが報告されている。また、うつ病と性別がrACCのシータ活動に影響を与える傾向が示されており、抗うつ剤治療への反応者には前頭皮質およびrACCの低シータ活動が見られる。
Alpha波特性: アルファ波（8-13Hz）は、皮質活動と逆相関があり、右前頭皮質活動の増加は負の情報や感情の処理中に現れる傾向がある。一方、左前頭皮質活動の増加は正の情報や感情処理と関連している。うつ病患者では、全体的な前頭および頭頂アルファ波パワーの増加と左中前頭部の活動低下が見られる。
Beta波特性: ベータ波（13-30Hz）は、前帯状皮質（ACC）において報酬予測、選択バイアスの大きさ、および報酬受領と関連している。また、注意および高齢者の視覚パフォーマンスにおける注意欠陥と関連がある。
Gamma波特性: ガンマ波（30-100Hz以上）は、前帯状皮質（ACC）において、学習、記憶、注意、情報処理などの認知機能と関連している。帯状回てんかんにおけるデフォルトモードネットワークで重要な役割を果たす可能性があり、適応的および安定的な行動期間中に高ガンマ活動の協調が見られる。
結合パターン: BA32を含む前帯状皮質（ACC）は、情報処理と調節の中心的な役割を果たす。長期記憶における新皮質表象領域と関連しており、記憶固定に重要な役割を果たす。また、眼窩前頭皮質や扁桃体からの情報を受け取り、注意と感情調節に関与している。うつ病患者では、ACCの機能的結合の変化が観察される。
臨床的意義: BA32を含む前帯状皮質（ACC）は、感情と理性のバランスをとり、感情の均衡を維持する上で重要な役割を果たす。うつ病などの気分障害において、ACCの活動変化や機能的結合の異常が観察される。例えば、うつ病患者ではACCのシータ活動の変調が見られ、抗うつ剤治療への反応と関連する。また、慢性ストレスによる灰白質減少の主要な焦点となる可能性も指摘されている。

Subject: BA33
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 33 (BA33), also known as pregenual area 33, is a subdivision of the cytoarchitecturally defined cingulate region of the cerebral cortex. It is a narrow band located in the anterior cingulate gyrus adjacent to the supracallosal gyrus in the depth of the callosal sulcus, near the genu of the corpus callosum. Cytoarchitecturally it is bounded by the ventral anterior cingulate area 24 and the supracallosal gyrus.
主要機能: Heavily involved in emotions, especially happy emotions. It is part of the limbic system, which plays a significant role in emotion and memory. It is closely connected through neural pathways with other limbic system areas (BA23, BA24, BA28) that support emotional responses and memory functions. It contributes to emotional regulation, motivation, error detection, and control of automatic bodily functions like heart rate.
Delta波特性: Delta waves are the slowest brainwaves and are most prominent during deep, dreamless sleep and unconsciousness. They are generally associated with deep sleep and restorative processes.
Theta波特性: Higher theta activity within the anterior cingulate cortex is often interpreted as an electrophysiological manifestation of higher cognitive load or emotional processing. Increased theta activity in the pregenual anterior cingulate cortex is associated with tinnitus onset. Theta waves are generally associated with relaxation, meditation, and creativity.
Alpha波特性: Reduced alpha connectivity between BA32 and BA33 in conditions like Alzheimer's disease and mild cognitive impairment. Alpha1 activity can be generated in anterior (BA33) cingulate cortex.
Beta波特性: Increased high beta brain oscillations are associated with the presence of pain. Beta waves are generally associated with active, busy, or anxious thinking and active concentration.
Gamma波特性: Gamma waves are associated with strong mental activities such as studying and solving problems, and higher-order cognitive functions.
結合パターン: Area 33prime (a subregion of BA33) is connected to areas IFSa, IFJa, and p9-46v in the lateral frontal lobe, areas a24prime and p24prime in the medial frontal lobe, areas TE1p and PHT in the temporal lobe, and areas IP1 and IP2 in the parietal lobe. It is structurally connected to the cingulum. Fibers project anteriorly above the corpus callosum to end at a24, p32, and 10r. Anterior fibers also curve around the rostrum of the corpus callosum to end at 25. Posterior cingulum fibers terminate at the precuneus to end at areas 7m and v23ab. Posterior fibers also curve around the splenium of the corpus callosum to end at the RSC. The pregenual anterior cingulate cortex has onward effective connectivity directed to the hippocampal system, both directly and via the subiculum.
臨床的意義: Involved in emotional regulation, attention, and pain processing. Aberrant subgenual cingulate-dorsolateral prefrontal connectivity, particularly reduced alpha connectivity, may serve as an electrophysiological marker for depression. Increased theta activity in the pregenual anterior cingulate cortex is associated with tinnitus onset. Deep brain stimulation (DBS) of the subgenual cingulate gyrus (which includes BA33) is beneficial in treatment-resistant depression.

Subject: BA34
解剖学的位置: Part of the entorhinal area and the superior temporal gyrus. The entorhinal area is located in the medial temporal lobe.
主要機能: Main interface between the hippocampus and neocortex, involved in memory, navigation, and the perception of time. Destruction of BA34 results in ipsilateral anosmia.
Delta波特性: The entorhinal cortex generates delta activity. Delta oscillations in the temporoammonic pathway neurons (part of EC) are generated via hyperpolarization-activated cyclic-nucleotide-gated (HCN) channels during sleep. These delta oscillations are critical for memory consolidation; their blockade significantly impairs hippocampus-dependent memory consolidation.
Theta波特性: The power of theta oscillations (4–8 Hz) in the human entorhinal cortex exhibits 6-fold rotational modulation by movement direction during spatial navigation. This modulation is specific to 6-fold rotational symmetry and the entorhinal cortex, emerging during fast movements and stabilizing over the experiment.
Alpha波特性: In the entorhinal cortex, the local alpha pacemaking role may be taken by supragranular pyramidal neurons. Alpha oscillations (8-13 Hz) are part of the theta/alpha band activity (2-12 Hz) commonly observed in the human medial temporal lobe, which includes the entorhinal cortex.
Beta波特性: In the entorhinal cortex, coherent activity in the beta frequency band (35-40 Hz) can be observed between the entorhinal cortex and the olfactory bulb/prepiriform cortex. This coupling is strong between the prepiriform cortex and the rostral part of the EC, decreasing towards more lateral, caudal, and medial areas. Beta activity is locally generated in layer II of the EC.
Gamma波特性: Gamma oscillations (40–100 Hz) occur within the superficial layers (I–III) of the entorhinal cortex, increasing in amplitude and regularity in association with entorhinal theta waves. These oscillations reflect synchronized synaptic potentials impinging on layer II–III neurons. They are coupled with theta and gamma oscillations in the dentate hilar region. Layer II–III neurons discharge in temporally defined gamma windows (∼10–25 msec) coupled to the theta cycle, which is essential for effective neuronal communication and synaptic plasticity in the perforant pathway.
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 34 is part of the entorhinal cortex (EC). The EC has intricate connections with the hippocampus and a vast array of neocortical areas. The medial entorhinal cortex (MEC) is more strongly connected with the presubiculum and retrosplenial cortex (RSC), while the lateral entorhinal cortex (LEC) is more strongly connected with distal CA1 and proximal subiculum (dCA1pSub) and lateral orbitofrontal cortex (OFC).
臨床的意義: The entorhinal cortex (EC), which includes BA34, is a critical brain region affected in the early phases of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It is considered one of the earliest regions affected by AD-associated pathology. The dorsal entorhinal cortex (Brodmann area 34) has been identified as having a high discriminative weight in classifying AD patients from healthy controls, often showing patterns of hypometabolism/atrophy in AD.

Subject: BA35
解剖学的位置: BA35, along with BA36, comprises the perirhinal cortex. It is a cytoarchitecturally defined temporal region of the cerebral cortex, located along the rhinal sulcus in the human brain. Medially, it is bounded by entorhinal area 28, and laterally by ectorhinal area 36.
主要機能: The perirhinal cortex (including BA35) is a multimodal area important for normal memory function and involved in complex conjunctive representations of visual information.
Delta波特性: The slow sleep oscillation (0.5-1 Hz), pervasive in the neocortex, is present in the perirhinal cortex, though its temporal relation to the neocortical oscillation is highly variable.
Theta波特性: During waking and paradoxical sleep, multiple simultaneously recorded entorhinal and perirhinal sites display a highly correlated oscillation in the theta range. Perirhinal cells show a statistically significant theta-related modulation of their spontaneous activity, albeit weaker than in the entorhinal cortex.
Alpha波特性: Increased coherence in the alpha band (8-12 Hz) has been observed between the hippocampus and perirhinal cortex, suggesting its involvement in memory processes, specifically in item recognition (IR) or source recognition (SR) decoupling.
Beta波特性: Specific characteristics for BA35 are not explicitly detailed, but general beta oscillations in the hippocampus are suggested to have dual roles in sensory- and memory-guided behaviors.
Gamma波特性: Gamma oscillations coordinate amygdalo-rhinal interactions during learning, indicating their presence and role in memory formation and inter-regional communication within the perirhinal cortex and lateral amygdala.
結合パターン: The perirhinal cortex is more closely related to the entorhino-hippocampal system than to the neocortex in terms of spontaneous EEG rhythms. High correlation is found between perirhinal and entorhinal electroencephalographic activities in all behavioral states. The perirhinal cortex has heavy connections with the amygdala, the hippocampus (mainly indirectly via the entorhinal cortex), the striatum, and with various sensory cortices. Enhanced connectivity between the perirhinal cortex and hippocampus is associated with behavioral markers of memory. BA35 is highly connected to other regions, and disrupted functional connectivity between the perirhinal cortex and other regions is observed in MCI and AD.
臨床的意義: The perirhinal cortex (PrC), including BA35, is among the first brain areas to deteriorate in Alzheimer's disease (AD). BA35 approximates the transentorhinal region, which is the first supratentorial brain region affected by neurofibrillary tangle pathology in AD. The largest reduction in thickness associated with aMCI (amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairment) was found in left BA35. Tau pathology in BA35 is negatively associated with cognitive decline, suggesting a complex role in disease progression.

Subject: BA36
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 36, together with Brodmann area 35, comprise the perirhinal cortex. It is cytoarchitecturally defined as a temporal region of the cerebral cortex. In humans, it is located primarily in the fusiform gyrus, with its medial boundary corresponding approximately to the rhinal sulcus. Cytoarchitecturally, it is bounded laterally and caudally by the inferior temporal area 20, medially by area 35, and rostrally by the temporopolar area 38.
主要機能: Its function is part of the formation/consolidation and retrieval of declarative/hippocampal memory, including for faces. There is also evidence that area 36 may be associated with emotion regulation.
Delta波特性: The slow sleep oscillation (0.5-1 Hz), pervasive in the neocortex, was present in the perirhinal cortex, though its temporal relation to the neocortical oscillation was highly variable.
Theta波特性: During waking and paradoxical sleep, multiple simultaneously recorded entorhinal and perirhinal sites displayed an oscillation in the theta range which was highly correlated. Perirhinal cells showed a statistically significant theta-related modulation of their spontaneous activity, albeit weaker than in the entorhinal cortex.
Alpha波特性: Neocortical sleep spindles (typically 11-16 Hz) were absent from the perirhinal cortex.
Beta波特性: No specific mention of Beta wave characteristics in the abstract, but the absence of sleep spindles (which overlap with lower Beta) is noted.
Gamma波特性: No specific mention of Gamma wave characteristics in the abstract.
結合パターン: Part of the perirhinal cortex, connected with BA35. Bounded laterally and caudally by inferior temporal area 20, medially by area 35, and rostrally by temporopolar area 38.
臨床的意義: Brodmann Area 36 (BA36) is implicated in several clinical conditions, particularly neurodegenerative diseases. It experiences significant perfusion impairments in early Alzheimer's Disease (AD). Atrophy of BA36 has been shown to differentiate age-related subjective memory decline from cognitively normal older adults and is associated with reduced neuronal pentraxin-2 (NPTX2), a marker of synaptic integrity that is diminished in AD. Furthermore, tau burden in BA36 is linked to pathological changes that vary with age, and at later Braak stages of AD, tau pathology is observed to spread into this region. Abnormalities in the perirhinal cortex, which includes BA36, may also disrupt hippocampal function, leading to impaired learning and memory, as observed in genetic models of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).

Subject: BA37
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 37 (BA37), also known as occipitotemporal area 37 (H), is a subdivision of the cytoarchitecturally defined temporal region of the cerebral cortex. It is located primarily in the caudal portions of the fusiform gyrus and inferior temporal gyrus on the mediobasal and lateral surfaces at the caudal extreme of the temporal lobe. It is bounded caudally by Brodmann area 19, rostrally by inferior temporal area 20 and middle temporal area 21, and dorsally by angular area 39.
主要機能: BA37 plays a crucial role in facial recognition, complex visual processing, object naming, and recognition memory. It is involved in phonological retrieval, semantic processing, and is a common node for visual recognition and semantic language functions. It also contributes to deductive reasoning and visuomotor orientation.
Delta波特性: Delta wave activity in BA37 has been observed to increase during non-dreaming sleep. Studies also indicate that 2-4 Hz delta power can be found in BA37, and changes in delta frequency characteristics are noted in dementia patients.
Theta波特性: Theta wave activity in BA37 is generally associated with memory processing and navigation. Studies suggest that theta activity can be observed in BA37, and changes in theta coherence in frontal regions are linked to executive functions. Theta waves become more widespread in the evening and are associated with slower reaction times.
Alpha波特性: BA37 (fusiform gyrus) shows significant changes in alpha-rhythm intensity, particularly in the T6 electrode area. Alpha activity is also associated with visual processing and can be increased by motion-sensitive visual processes.
Beta波特性: Beta waves in BA37 are generally associated with active mental states and cognitive processing. While specific details for BA37 are limited, beta activity is often observed during focused attention and problem-solving, which aligns with BA37's role in complex visual and semantic processing.
Gamma波特性: Gamma waves in BA37 are associated with higher-order cognitive functions, such as face processing and object recognition. Intracranial EEG studies in the fusiform gyrus (part of BA37) show face-selective spectral changes, indicating gamma band activity during face perception. Gamma activity is generally linked to strong mental activities like studying and problem-solving.
結合パターン: BA37 is a common node of two distinct networks: visual recognition (perception) and semantic language functions. It shows significant connections with the left visual association area (BA19) and other parts of the temporal lobe (BA20, BA21, BA22, BA39). Its connectivity with the parahippocampal gyrus suggests involvement in memory processing. It is also part of a complex brain network for deductive reasoning, including BA21/22/24/32/37/45/46/47.
臨床的意義: BA37 is characterized by significant hypoperfusion and neurofibrillary tangle (NFT) pathology in clinical disorders like Alzheimer's disease. Lesions in the fusiform gyrus (part of BA37) can result in visual agnosia for objects, prosopagnosia (inability to recognize faces), and pure alexia (inability to read). It is also implicated in neurological phenomena such as synesthesia, dyslexia, and memory loss in aging and dementia. Restoring blood flow to BA37 is critical for helping patients regain naming abilities.

Subject: BA38
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 38 (BA38), also known as the temporopolar area, is located at the anterior end of the temporal lobe, referred to as the temporal pole. It is a subdivision of the cytoarchitecturally defined temporal region of the cerebral cortex, primarily found in the most rostral portions of the superior temporal gyrus and the middle temporal gyrus. It is caudally bounded by inferior temporal area 20, middle temporal area 21, superior temporal area 22, and ectorhinal area 36.
主要機能: BA38 is a paralimbic region involved in high-level semantic representation and socio-emotional processing. It is a convergence zone where semantic memories stored in the ventral anterior temporal lobe are imbued with emotional significance and personal meaning. It also stores concepts of individual people, abstracted from perceptual representations, in a “face patch.”
Delta波特性: Specific normal delta wave characteristics for BA38 are not explicitly detailed in the provided search results. Generally, delta waves (0.5-4Hz) are associated with deep, dreamless sleep.
Theta波特性: Specific normal theta wave characteristics for BA38 are not explicitly detailed in the provided search results. Generally, theta waves (4-8Hz) are associated with creativity, intuition, daydreaming, and light sleep.
Alpha波特性: Specific normal alpha wave characteristics for BA38 are not explicitly detailed in the provided search results. Generally, alpha waves (8-13Hz) are associated with a relaxed, wakeful state.
Beta波特性: Specific normal beta wave characteristics for BA38 are not explicitly detailed in the provided search results. Generally, beta waves (13-30Hz) are associated with active thinking, alertness, and concentration.
Gamma波特性: Specific normal gamma wave characteristics for BA38 are not explicitly detailed in the provided search results. Generally, gamma waves (30-100Hz+) are associated with high-level cognitive processing, learning, and memory formation.
結合パターン: The uncinate fasciculus provides a direct bidirectional path to the orbitofrontal cortex, allowing mnemonic representations stored in the temporal pole to bias decision making in the frontal lobe.
臨床的意義: Damage to the temporal pole can cause amnestic prosopagnosia (loss of recognition of familiar faces). Bilateral damage can lead to dramatic personality changes, as seen in Klüver-Bucy syndrome (fearlessness, hypersexuality, hyperorality) when combined with amygdala damage. BA38 is among the earliest areas affected by Alzheimer's disease, frontotemporal dementia, frontotemporal lobar degeneration, and is commonly involved at the start of temporal lobe seizures.

Subject: BA39
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 39 (BA39), also known as the angular gyrus, is part of the parietal cortex in the human brain. It encompasses the angular gyrus, lying near the junction of temporal, occipital, and parietal lobes. It is located posterior to the supramarginal gyrus, the second region that forms the inferior parietal lobule. The two angular gyri are connected via the isthmus of the corpus callosum and dorsal splenium. Its blood supply arises from the middle cerebral artery.
主要機能: Primary functions include spatial cognition, language processes (reading, writing, and interpretation of written words), attention, number processing, memory retrieval, social cognition, and conflict resolution.
Delta波特性: Less frequent delta waves appear in the angular gyrus. BA39 has been identified as a delta generator. Delta oscillations may inhibit interferences affecting mental tasks by modulating networks, and increase during internal concentration.
Theta波特性: Continuous theta burst stimulation (cTBS) over the left angular gyrus has been shown to reduce mind wandering propensity and plays a causal role in insight-driven memory updating. Decreased theta power has been observed in the angular gyrus during episodic memory encoding.
Alpha波特性: Angular gyrus alpha oscillations are involved in context-driven perception. Resting-state modulation of alpha rhythms by interference with angular gyrus activity can enhance dominant idling EEG alpha rhythms. Connectivity at alpha oscillations is reduced during tonic pain.
Beta波特性: Connectivity at beta oscillations in the angular gyrus is reduced during tonic pain. Increased activity in high beta waves of BA39 has been observed in relation to own-body perceptions.
Gamma波特性: Increased high gamma power has been observed in the angular gyrus during episodic memory encoding.
結合パターン: BA39 forms connections with the ipsilateral prefrontal cortex, inferior and superior frontal cortices (involved in attention and calculation), opercular cortex, parahippocampal gyrus and hippocampus (involved in memory and spatial orientation), supramarginal gyrus (involved in processing sensory modalities: proprioceptive, auditory, visual, and somatosensory), and the caudate nucleus (involved in the cognitive loop of the brain). The superior longitudinal fasciculus connects it to prefrontal and inferior frontal cortices, including the arcuate fasciculus.
臨床的意義: Lesions to the angular gyrus can result in Gerstmann syndrome (problems with arithmetic, writing, telling left from right, and inability to tell one’s fingers apart), behavioral changes, and reduced activity in dyslexic patients. Damage to the left BA39 may result in dyslexia or semantic aphasia. Electrical stimulation of the right angular gyrus can induce an 'out-of-body' experience.

Subject: BA40
解剖学的位置: ブロードマン領域40（BA40）は、ヒトの脳の頭頂皮質の一部であり、下頭頂小葉（IPL）内に位置する縁上回に相当します。側頭裂の後端に位置し、下頭頂小葉の前方部分を形成します。解剖学的には、内頭頂溝、下中心後溝、後下中心溝、外側溝によっておおよそ境界が定められています。尾側は角回39野、吻側および背側は尾側中心後野2、腹側は下中心野43および上側頭野22（ブロードマン-1909）によって境界が定められています。BA40の細胞構築は、すべての皮質層に比較的小さなニューロンが存在し、V層とVI層は細胞密度が低く、II層とIV層は広く、顕著で微細な柱状の細胞配列が特徴です。BA40は、PF、PFop（弁蓋部）、PFt（薄い皮質帯）、PFm（大細胞部）、PFcm（大細胞柱状部）などの複数の細胞構築領域に細分されます。
主要機能: BA40の縁上回部分は、意味と音韻の両方に関する読解に関与しています。BA40/縁上回の吻側部分の細胞構築学的に定義された下位領域には、PF、PFcm、PFm、PFop、PFtがあります。PF領域はマカクザルのPF領域のホモログであり、ミラーニューロンシステムの一部であり、ヒトの模倣中に活動します。BA40は下頭頂多感覚連合皮質の主要な構成要素であり、感覚モダリティの統合に関与しています。音韻、読解、綴りなどの受容言語処理、および量や数などの抽象概念の空間的・象徴的表現に関与しています。顔と手の協調運動に寄与する可能性があります。音韻的短期記憶の「貯蔵」要素の重要な神経基盤です。追跡眼球運動と固視の制御、空間的注意、感覚運動協調に関与しています。BA40は二次体性感覚皮質（SII）の一部を形成し、一次体性感覚皮質と視床からの入力を受け、体性感覚情報を他の感覚モダリティと統合します。BA40の前方部分の活動は、道具使用行動の実行と観察と相関しています。
Delta波特性: BA40（中心後回）におけるDelta波（0.5-4Hz）活動の増加は、アルツハイマー病患者において健常対照群と比較して観察されています。また、深い睡眠や一部の異常なプロセスと関連しており、共感にも関与しています。睡眠開始移行期の研究では、BA40におけるDelta帯域の活性化が示されています。
Theta波特性: BA40（下頭頂小葉）におけるTheta波（4-8Hz）活動の増加は、アルツハイマー病患者において観察されています。小児の覚醒時EEGにおけるTheta波は、夕方により広範囲に広がり、反応時間の遅延と関連しています。ACCとBA40間のTheta位相同期が観察されています。BA40に局所化されたTheta波活動の遅延は、認知処理の低下や社会的合図の処理・統合の困難と関連しており、ニューロフィードバックの対象となることがあります。
Alpha波特性: BA40におけるAlpha波（8-13Hz）の活動は、アノード経頭蓋直流刺激によって増加することが観察されています。また、BA40に局所化されたAlpha波活動の低下は、認知処理の低下や社会的合図の処理・統合の困難と関連しており、ニューロフィードバックの対象となることがあります。一般的に、Alpha波は目を閉じてリラックスした覚醒状態と関連しています。
Beta波特性: ブロードマン領域40（左下頭頂小葉）におけるBeta-1活動の増加は、LORETA分析によって明らかにされています。また、左縁上回（BA40）におけるBetaバーストは、記憶符号化のための注意配分と関連しています。
Gamma波特性: 40Hzのガンマ脳活動に関する一般的な情報（例：集中力のためのバイノーラルビート）は存在しますが、BA40の機能や臨床的意義に直接関連するガンマ波の具体的な特性に関する詳細な研究は、提供された検索結果には明示されていません。しかし、左縁上回（BA40）における高ガンマバーストは、記憶符号化のための注意配分との関連で言及されています。
結合パターン: BA40は複雑な構造的および機能的結合パターンを示します。内側側頭葉領域、前頭皮質、側頭皮質と強固な結合があります。短い連合線維が縁上回（BA40）と角回（BA39）を相互に結合しています。下頭頂小葉は後頭頂皮質の腹側に位置し、吻側は中心後溝、背側は内頭頂溝に接しています。BA40は音韻的ワーキングメモリ課題中に活性化されます。
臨床的意義: BA40の病変、特に左下頭頂小葉の病変は、伝導性失語症（流暢な発話、良好な理解、劣悪な反復、パラグラマティックな誤り、失名詞、音韻性錯語）と関連しています。BA40はウェルニッケ野の一部でもあり、この領域の病変はウェルニッケ失語症（理解、命名、反復、読み書き能力の障害）に寄与する可能性があります。空間性無視や注意障害は、BA40を含む下頭頂小葉の損傷または機能不全と頻繁に関連しています。縁上回の構造的損傷は無視に非常に特異的です。構成失行の原因となる中心病変は、左縁上回（BA40）の前方部分にあります。BA40に局所化されたAlpha波またはTheta波活動の遅延は、認知処理の低下や社会的合図の処理・統合の困難と相関しています。病変研究は、BA40付近の損傷が夢の全体的な停止につながり、視空間能力と心的イメージの低下を伴うことを示しています。

Subject: BA41
解剖学的位置: The primary auditory cortex (Brodmann area 41) is located in the superior portion of the temporal lobe, specifically in the part of the temporal gyrus which forms the inferior wall of the posterior ramus of the lateral sulcus. It is situated deep in the Sylvian fissure on the temporal transverse gyrus (Heschl's gyrus) and is surrounded caudolaterally by the secondary auditory area 42, rostrally and laterally by areas 22 and 42, and medially by area 52. Area 41 has the typical koniocortical structure of primary sensory areas, characterized by a well-developed layer IV with densely packed small neurons and a high cell density invading the supragranular layer III.
主要機能: Part of the primary auditory cortex, serving as the first cortical destination for auditory information from the thalamus. Neurons are tuned to pure tones and pitch. Exhibits a tonotopic organization, with responses to low-frequency stimuli originating more laterally and high-frequency stimuli originating more medially. Neural activity strongly correlates with the objective physical properties of sound. Involved in early stages of phonological processing (phoneme recognition).
Delta波特性: Attention is associated with the entrainment of delta rhythms (1-4 Hz) in the primary auditory cortex. Delta phase of EEG can track the dynamics of a moving auditory stimulus. Dominant delta frequency neuronal activity in all cortical layers of the primary auditory cortex is largely coherent with external stimuli.
Theta波特性: Increased theta wave activity has been observed in the superior temporal gyrus (including BA41) in patients with Alzheimer's disease. Theta wave activation has also been found in the superior temporal gyrus (BA 41-22) in response to social exclusion stimuli.
Alpha波特性: Alpha power of EEG can track the dynamics of a moving auditory stimulus. Auditory alpha rhythms track the temporal structure of acoustic signals, aiding in speech comprehension and rhythm processing. A sound-sensitive source of alpha oscillations exists in the human auditory cortex, associated with functions like sensory prediction and inhibition of regions handling irrelevant information.
Beta波特性: Experimentally, beta frequency oscillations are generated following periods of synchronous gamma frequency activity. They represent a dynamic method of generating and recalling stimulus-specific assemblies of neurons. Long-range (multimodal) sensory coding is performed at beta frequencies.
Gamma波特性: Transient bursts of gamma oscillations can be detected in response to sensory stimulation. These can be stimulus-evoked (tightly time and phase-locked) or stimulus-induced (variable latency). Short-latency gamma-band oscillations have been found in the auditory potential within 100 ms from stimulus onset. Evoked gamma may reflect synchronously active neural assemblies or signal precise temporal relationships of incoming stimuli. Induced gamma may reflect object representation or activation of associative memories.
結合パターン: BA41 has strong connections with the secondary auditory areas, specifically Brodmann Area 42 and Brodmann Area 22. These connections are often bidirectional. Functional connectivity can extend to other brain regions, including motor areas, and potentially Broca's area and higher-order extrastriate cortex (V3).
臨床的意義: In Alzheimer's disease, the primary auditory cortex (BA41) appears to be relatively preserved, showing minimal pathological changes compared to auditory association areas like BA22. Individuals with congenital deafness lack auditory stimulation to the primary auditory cortex, leading to significant implications for auditory processing development. Patients with schizophrenia often exhibit lower performance on tasks dependent on primary auditory cortex function, suggesting its involvement in the pathology of the disorder. Dysfunction in BA41 can contribute to various auditory processing disorders, affecting the perception and interpretation of sound. The primary auditory cortex demonstrates significant neuroplasticity, meaning its structure and function can adapt in response to experience, training, or injury, which is crucial for rehabilitation efforts in auditory impairments.

Subject: BA42
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 42, also known as the posterior transverse temporal area 42 (H), is a subdivision of the temporal lobe. It is bounded medially by the anterior transverse temporal area 41 (H) and laterally by the superior temporal area 22.
主要機能: BA42 is part of the primary auditory cortex. It serves as the first cortical destination for auditory information originating from the thalamus. Neural activity within this region is strongly correlated with the objective physical properties of sound.
Delta波特性: Typically associated with deep, dreamless sleep in adults. In the context of auditory processing, increased delta activity might indicate a state of reduced auditory attention or deep relaxation. However, delta oscillations can also play a role in sensory processing, including auditory, particularly in coordinating neural activity across larger brain networks.
Theta波特性: Often linked to states of drowsiness, light sleep, meditation, and memory encoding/retrieval. In the auditory cortex, theta activity might be involved in processing novel auditory stimuli, working memory for sounds, or during tasks requiring sustained auditory attention.
Alpha波特性: Typically observed during relaxed wakefulness, especially with closed eyes, and is associated with inhibition of irrelevant sensory information. In the auditory cortex, alpha waves might reflect a state of auditory idling or active suppression of distracting auditory input, allowing for focused attention on specific sounds.
Beta波特性: Associated with active thinking, problem-solving, concentration, and alert wakefulness. In BA42, beta activity could be prominent during active auditory processing, such as analyzing complex sound patterns, speech comprehension, or responding to auditory cues.
Gamma波特性: Linked to higher-level cognitive functions, sensory binding, perception, and consciousness. In the primary auditory cortex, gamma oscillations are crucial for precise temporal coding of auditory information, integrating different features of a sound (e.g., pitch, timbre, location), and forming coherent auditory percepts. High gamma activity is often observed during active listening and auditory discrimination tasks.
結合パターン: As part of the primary auditory cortex, BA42 exhibits significant connectivity with other auditory and related brain regions. Effective connectivity has been observed between the primary auditory cortex (which includes BA42) and the lateral planum polare and anterior Superior Temporal Gyrus (STG), as well as the lateral planum temporale and posterior STG. The primary auditory cortex receives input from the ventral division of the medial geniculate nucleus of the thalamus.
臨床的意義: Dysfunction or damage to Brodmann Area 42, as part of the primary auditory cortex, can lead to various auditory processing deficits and has been implicated in several clinical conditions, including Auditory Processing Disorder (APD), Cortical Deafness, Bipolar Disorder, Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD), and Temporal Order Processing Deficits.

Subject: BA43
解剖学的位置: Subcentral area, a structurally distinct area of the cerebral cortex defined by cytoarchitecture. Subdivision of the postcentral region of the brain. Occupies the postcentral gyrus, located between the ventrolateral extreme of the central sulcus and the depth of the lateral sulcus, at the insula. Rostral border: approximated by the anterior subcentral sulcus. Caudal border: approximated by the posterior subcentral sulcus. Cytoarchitecturally bounded rostrally by agranular frontal area 6, and caudally by caudal postcentral area 2 and supramarginal area 40.
主要機能: Primarily considered the primary gustatory cortex, responsible for processing taste perception. Responds to pressure on the eardrum and to oral intake (eating and drinking). May be the primary somatosensory cortex of the eardrum due to its response to eating and drinking changing middle ear pressure. Also reported to respond to tactile stimulation of the fingers. Involved in functional activation during semantic analysis, particularly in tasks involving selection of a verbal response from many possibilities.
Delta波特性: Research suggests delta activity encodes taste information in the human brain, indicating its involvement in fundamental taste processing within BA43.
Theta波特性: Generally associated with memory, navigation, and internal focus. While not directly linked to BA43, its role in complex cognitive tasks like semantic analysis might involve theta activity during memory retrieval or focused attention related to taste perception or somatosensory processing.
Alpha波特性: Typically associated with a relaxed, wakeful state. In BA43, alpha waves might reflect a resting state or inhibition of non-relevant sensory input during specific gustatory or somatosensory tasks.

Subject: BA44
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 44 (BA44) is located in the pars opercularis of the inferior frontal gyrus, part of the frontal cortex in the human brain. It is situated anterior to the premotor cortex (BA6) and inferior to BA9. Its boundaries include the inferior precentral sulcus caudally, the anterior ascending limb of the lateral sulcus rostrally, and it surrounds the diagonal sulcus. It borders the insula in the depth of the lateral sulcus. Cytoarchitectonically, it is bounded caudally and dorsally by agranular frontal area 6, dorsally by granular frontal area 9, and rostrally by the triangular part of the inferior frontal gyrus (BA45).
主要機能: BA44 is a central node in language production, particularly in encoding phonological word forms into articulatory plans, syntactic processing, speech articulation, and fluency. It is a key component of Broca's area (along with BA45). Beyond language, BA44 is involved in motor functions, including hand movements, and is part of the mirror neuron system, supporting action recognition and manual praxis. It also plays a role in selective response suppression (especially right BA44), working memory, pain anticipation, tactile stimulation, and object manipulation.

General gamma activity (30-100Hz+) is associated with higher-level cognitive processing, perception, and consciousness. While BA44 is involved in complex cognitive functions, specific gamma patterns for this area were not found.
結合パターン: BA44 exhibits strong cortical connections with BA45, the premotor cortex (BA6), and the superior temporal gyrus. It forms robust links with lateral temporal cortex areas, crucial for speech processing in the left hemisphere. Subcortical connections include pathways to the basal ganglia, thalamus, and corticospinal tract, forming a cortico-thalamo-cortical circuitry proposed to subserve computational grammar. White matter pathways involve dorsal and ventral language streams: the dorsal pathway connects the superior temporal gyrus to BA44 via the arcuate fasciculus and superior longitudinal fasciculus (auditory-motor integration, higher-level language functions); the ventral pathway links BA45 and temporal cortex through the extreme capsule fiber system, and the uncinate fasciculus connects the frontal operculum with anterior superior temporal gyrus/sulcus. The arcuate fasciculus connects BA44 and Wernicke's area, facilitating speech production and reading aloud.
臨床的意義: Lesions in BA44 are classically associated with Broca's aphasia, characterized by nonfluent, effortful, agrammatic, and telegraphic speech, poor naming, semantic and phonemic paraphasic errors, impaired repetition, and relatively spared comprehension. Lesions often extend to surrounding frontal areas, white matter, and basal ganglia. More restricted lesions can lead to aphemia (milder, transient motor speech impairment). Speech dyspraxia (apraxia of speech) is also linked to BA44 lesions, manifesting as deficits in articulatory planning and effortful, dysprosodic speech. BA44 abnormalities or altered connectivity are associated with developmental and acquired language disorders like specific language impairment (SLI), progressive nonfluent aphasia, and stuttering. Therapeutic approaches like low-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (LF-rTMS) targeting the right inferior frontal gyrus (contralesional homologue) combined with speech therapy have shown improvements in nonfluent aphasia.

Subject: BA45
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 45 (BA45) is part of the frontal cortex in the human brain. It is situated on the lateral surface, inferior to BA9 and adjacent to BA46. This area occupies the triangular part of the inferior frontal gyrus and, surrounding the anterior horizontal limb of the lateral sulcus, a portion of the orbital part of the inferior frontal gyrus. Bounded caudally by the anterior ascending limb of the lateral sulcus, it borders on the insula in the depth of the lateral sulcus. In terms of cytoarchitecture, it is bounded caudally by the opercular part of inferior frontal gyrus (Brodmann area 44 (BA44)), rostrodorsally by the middle frontal area 46 (BA46), and ventrally by the orbital part of inferior frontal gyrus (Brodmann area 47 (BA47)).
主要機能: BA45, particularly in the left hemisphere, along with BA44, constitutes Broca's area, which is active in semantic tasks. These tasks include semantic decision tasks (determining whether a word represents an abstract or concrete entity) and generation tasks (generating a verb associated with a noun). While its precise role in semantic tasks is debated, some researchers suggest it subserves semantic retrieval or semantic working memory processes, guiding the recovery and evaluation of semantic information. Another view proposes that BA45 activation is needed only under controlled semantic retrieval when strong stimulus-stimulus associations are absent. Other researchers argue that BA45's role extends beyond semantics to all activities requiring the selection of task-relevant representations from among competing ones. Lesions of BA45 lead to expressive aphasia in individuals with left hemispheric dominance.
Delta波特性: Research indicates that delta-theta rhythms between the ventral prefrontal (including BA44/45) and lateral premotor areas show greater functional connectivity during action execution compared to action observation. Specifically, the event-related functional connectivity (ErLLC) of delta-theta (<6 Hz) rhythms between the lateral premotor (BA6) and ventral prefrontal (BA44/45) areas is enhanced during the execution of transitive actions.
Theta波特性: Research indicates that delta-theta rhythms between the ventral prefrontal (including BA44/45) and lateral premotor areas show greater functional connectivity during action execution compared to action observation. Specifically, the event-related functional connectivity (ErLLC) of delta-theta (<6 Hz) rhythms between the lateral premotor (BA6) and ventral prefrontal (BA44/45) areas is enhanced during the execution of transitive actions.
Alpha波特性: Alpha oscillations are observed in the inferior frontal cortex, including BA45. Increased alpha power in this region has been correlated with decreased MRI signals. A frontal-temporal alpha rhythm with a peak frequency of 8.3 Hz is generated in the inferior frontal/superior temporal cortex. Alpha oscillations are thought to play a role in orchestrating processing by inhibiting task-irrelevant regions and facilitating the activation of task-relevant regions.
Beta波特性: Beta-band oscillations in the right inferior frontal gyrus (rIFG), which includes BA45, are implicated in motor inhibitory control. Additionally, lower beta power in the inferior frontal gyrus has been associated with improved subsequent recall in long-term memory formation. Beta oscillations also play a role in attentional control.
Gamma波特性: While specific details for BA45 are limited, gamma-band activity is generally associated with various cognitive processes across cortical areas. Research indicates that neural representations of individual stimuli in humans are revealed by gamma-band electrocorticographic activity. More broadly, gamma oscillations are involved in higher-order cognitive functions, including attention, perception, and memory, and are observed in prefrontal cortical areas during movement execution and observation.
結合パターン: Brodmann Area 45 (BA45) exhibits a high degree of connectivity with other subregions of the inferior frontal gyrus (IFG), including BA44 and BA47. It is also strongly connected with lateral temporal cortex areas, such as the posterior temporal cortex. In the context of language processing, BA45 shows functional connections with the inferior temporal gyrus (ITG) during lexical decisions and visual word recognition. It is part of broader neural networks involved in language production, cognitive control, and working memory. The right inferior frontal gyrus (rIFG), which includes BA45, has functional connectivity with various brain regions and is implicated in attentional control and motor inhibitory control.
臨床的意義: Lesions involving BA45, often in conjunction with BA44 (Broca's area), are classically associated with Broca's aphasia (expressive aphasia), characterized by difficulties in speech production. Specifically, lesions of BA45 can lead to expressive aphasia in individuals with left hemispheric dominance. Pathological changes in BA44 and BA45 have also been linked to selective impairment of verb processing in conditions like motor neuron disease-dementia-aphasia syndrome. Reduced gray matter volume in BA45 has been associated with severe psychotic symptoms in patients with schizophrenia. Furthermore, hypometabolism in the left prefrontal cortex, including BA45, has been observed in depressed patients with Alzheimer's disease. A virtual lesion of the anterior part of Broca's area (left BA45) has been shown to delay the processing of cues initiating sequences in motor tasks. Abnormalities in BA45 are also associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder.

Subject: BA46
解剖学的位置: Brodmann area 46 (BA46) is part of the frontal cortex in the human brain, located between BA10 and BA45. It is also known as the middle frontal area 46, occupying approximately the middle third of the middle frontal gyrus and the middle portion of the inferior frontal gyrus. BA46 roughly corresponds with the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC). Cytoarchitecturally, it is characterized by a granular structure with a prominent granular layer IV, differentiating it from adjacent areas like BA9 and BA10. It is bounded dorsally by granular frontal area 9, rostroventrally by frontopolar area 10, and caudally by triangular area 45. It is oriented obliquely parallel to area 9-46d, extending from the depths of the superior frontal sulcus posteriorly toward the middle frontal gyrus anteriorly, bordered medially by area 9-46d, laterally by area p9-46v, anterolaterally by IFSa, anteriorly by a9-46v, and posteriorly by areas 8AV and 8AD.
主要機能: BA46, as part of the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), plays a central role in executive functions. Its primary functions include sustaining attention, managing working memory (both spatial, predominantly in the right hemisphere, and verbal, predominantly in the left hemisphere), and regulating self-control. It is involved in semantic processing and language-related working memory, particularly in tasks requiring temporary maintenance and manipulation of semantic information (e.g., verb generation, narrative speech). Additionally, BA46 contributes to decision-making, planning, mediating neural synchronization during parent-child interactions, and imitative learning. It is one of the few cortical areas whose activity diminishes during REM sleep.
Delta波特性: While specific characteristics for BA46 are not explicitly detailed, delta waves (0.5-4Hz) are generally associated with deep sleep. Studies on EEG frequency bands in the DLPFC (which includes BA46) analyze delta activity, but direct functional significance within BA46 for delta waves is not clearly specified in the reviewed literature.
Theta波特性: While specific characteristics for BA46 are not explicitly detailed, theta waves (4-8Hz) are generally associated with states of relaxation, drowsiness, and memory encoding. Studies on EEG frequency bands in the DLPFC (which includes BA46) analyze theta activity. Higher theta EEG power during resting state has been shown to predict lower cognitive functioning. Theta-gamma coupling has also been investigated as a predictor of working memory performance, suggesting an interaction of these frequencies in cognitive processes involving BA46.
Alpha波特性: The dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), which includes BA46, is involved in working memory. Alpha (8-13Hz) and beta (12-25Hz) bands are associated with processes necessary for memory functions. Alpha oscillations are also linked to cognitive functioning. In some studies, rTMS of DLPFC has shown to decrease power in higher frequency bands (beta and gamma) and transiently decrease low frequencies, which might include alpha. Brain oscillation-synchronized stimulation of the left DLPFC using real-time EEG-triggered TMS has been conducted focusing on instantaneous alpha oscillations.
Beta波特性: The dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), which includes BA46, is involved in working memory. Beta (13-30Hz) bands are associated with processes necessary for memory functions. In some studies, rTMS of DLPFC has shown to decrease power in higher frequency bands (beta and gamma). Beta waves are generally associated with active, busy, or anxious thinking and active concentration. While specific to BA46 is not explicitly detailed, as part of DLPFC, it would contribute to these states.
Gamma波特性: The dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), which includes BA46, is involved in complex cognitive functions. Gamma waves (30-100Hz or above) are generally associated with higher-order cognitive processing, such as perception, problem-solving, and consciousness. Some studies indicate that rTMS of DLPFC can decrease power in higher frequency bands, including gamma. Theta-gamma coupling has also been investigated as a predictor of working memory performance, suggesting an interaction of these frequencies in cognitive processes involving BA46.
結合パターン: BA46 exhibits high connectivity within the frontal lobe and with other brain parts. It connects with multiple brain regions including the dorsolateral frontal lobe, medial frontal lobe, premotor regions, orbitofrontal cortex, insula-opercular regions, temporal lobe, parietal lobe, medial parietal lobe, and occipital lobe. Structural connectivity involves white matter fiber tracts crossing the corpus callosum to contralateral areas 9-46d and p9-47v. Functionally, BA46 is negatively correlated with Brodmann area 25, a connection relevant to the clinical efficacy of TMS in treating depression. There is also anatomically specific functional connectivity between left BA46 and left M1 during selection of motor tasks.
臨床的意義: BA46 is implicated in the pathophysiology of several neuropsychiatric and neurological disorders. Dysfunctions in BA46 are frequently reported in schizophrenia, including hypofunction, hyperactivation, anomalies in functional connectivity with the medial temporal lobe, and reduced dendritic spine density. In major depressive disorder (MDD), reduced gray matter volume, aberrant activation, and functional anomalies are observed in BA46. A decrease in cerebral metabolic glucose in the right DLPFC (BA46) has been noted in treatment-resistant depression after vagus nerve stimulation. Damage to BA46 can impair short-term memory, inhibit responses, affect judgment of stimulus relevance, and cause organizational problems. Neuromodulation therapies targeting BA46, such as repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS), transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS), and transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS), have shown efficacy in improving working memory in schizophrenia and healthy subjects, and in treating depression.

Subject: BA47
解剖学的位置: Brodmann Area 47 (BA47) is part of the frontal cortex in the human brain. It curves from the lateral surface of the frontal lobe into the ventral (orbital) frontal cortex. It is located inferior to BA10 and BA45, and lateral to BA11. This cytoarchitectonic region largely corresponds to the orbital part of the inferior frontal gyrus. On the orbital surface, it surrounds the caudal portion of the orbital sulcus and extends laterally into the orbital part of the inferior frontal gyrus. Cytoarchitectonically, it is bounded caudally by the triangular area 45, medially by the prefrontal area 11, and rostrally by the frontopolar area 10.
主要機能: BA47 is primarily involved in language processing and comprehension, particularly in semantics (identifying the meaning of words and sentences). It plays a crucial role in processing both spoken and sign language. Additionally, BA47 is active in processing musical structure, especially when expectations are violated (e.g., 'scrambled' music), suggesting a more general role in processing fine-structured stimuli that evolve over time. It is also related to empathy towards story contents of others.
Delta波特性: Delta activity (0.5-4 Hz) in the frontal leads, including regions like BA47, can increase during mental tasks requiring concentration, such as mental calculation and semantic tasks. Increased delta slowing on scalp EEG is associated with intracranial hippocampal interictal epileptiform discharge.
Theta波特性: Theta activity (4-8 Hz) in the frontal lobe, including BA47, is associated with cognitive functions. Increased frontal theta activity has been observed in conditions like anorexia nervosa. Theta-alpha oscillations (4-13 Hz) in the prefrontal cortex are correlated with increased hippocampal connectivity during recollection. Theta activity in the inferior frontal gyri (including BA47) has been observed to increase during spatial navigation tasks.
Alpha波特性: Prefrontal cortex (including BA47) generates alpha rhythms, which are modulated during action execution and observation. Increased alpha activity in the right ventral lateral prefrontal cortex (BA47) has been observed in professional dancers during creative thinking tasks.
Beta波特性: Prefrontal cortex (including BA47) generates beta rhythms, which are modulated during action execution and observation. Beta power and beta envelope correlation are potential predictors of certain brain states.
Gamma波特性: Prefrontal cortex (including BA47) generates gamma rhythms, which are modulated during action execution and observation. Gamma power and theta-gamma coupling enhancement have been studied in the prefrontal cortex in relation to conditions like depression.
結合パターン: BA47 shows functional connectivity with other Brodmann areas involved in language (e.g., BA44, BA45, BA46) and is considered part of a 'frontal language network'. It also connects with the extrastriate cortex (BA19) and hippocampus (BA54). BA47's activation is associated with processing fine-structured stimuli that evolve over time, including linguistic and musical structures. It is also involved in corticostriatal circuits.
臨床的意義: Lesions to BA47 can result in difficulty processing words and understanding grammatical rules. Pathology in BA47, particularly of GABAergic interneurons, has been correlated with restricted repetitive behaviors in autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Decreased BA47 activation has been observed in conditions like bipolar I disorder. Abnormalities in BA47 may also be influenced by pathological severity in conditions like constant exotropia.
