Subject: BA51
解剖学的位置: In non-human species, Brodmann Area 51 is referred to as the Prepiriform area within the Olfactory region. It is described in species like Kinkajou, Rabbit, Ground Squirrel, and Hedgehog. In Hedgehog, it is expanded and subdivided into 51a, 51b, 51c, 51d [1]. In humans, the functionally equivalent Piriform Cortex is situated at the junction of the frontal and temporal lobes, medial to the temporal stem, lining the superior and inferior banks of the entorhinal sulcus. It is classified as part of the paleocortex, characterized by a three-layered allocortical organization. It is organized into anterior piriform cortex (APC) and posterior piriform cortex (PPC) and cytoarchitecturally comprises layer I (superficial plexiform), layer II (compact cell body layer), and layer III (deep pyramidal and multipolar cells) [3].
主要機能: In non-human species, Brodmann Area 51 is primarily associated with olfaction, specifically as the Prepiriform area [1]. In humans, the functionally equivalent Piriform Cortex is a critical area for olfactory processing, recognized as the largest and most distinctive component of the primary olfactory cortex [3]. It plays a central role in processing olfactory information, synthesizing odorant features into perceptual odor objects. It is also involved in higher-order brain functions, including memory, due to its extensive connections with limbic structures. It is implicated in the representation of odor quality, identity, and hedonics [3].
Delta波特性: During slow-wave sleep, anterior piriform cortex neurons show highly synchronized discharges that accompany olfactory cortex sharp waves (OC-SPWs) [7]. Slow-wave activity (SWA) is dominated by strong delta frequency power (1-4 Hz) and large slow waves at 1-2 Hz [7]. Anticipatory phase resetting in the piriform cortex improves perceptual accuracy [9].
Theta波特性: Odor stimulation enhances theta waves in the piriform cortex in humans [10, 11]. Piriform oscillatory activity conveys olfactory-specific information, maximally within the theta frequency [5, 8]. The piriform cortex is implicated in propagating the olfactory-bulb-driven respiratory rhythm [12].
Alpha波特性: No specific information found directly linking alpha waves to piriform cortex function in the provided search results.
Beta波特性: No specific information found directly linking beta waves to piriform cortex function in the provided search results.
Gamma波特性: Functional connectivity (high gamma band coherence) between the basolateral amygdala (BLA) and posterior piriform cortex (pPCX) is enhanced after differential odor fear conditioning [13].
結合パターン: Afferent inputs to the human piriform cortex primarily come from mitral and tufted cells of the olfactory bulb via the lateral olfactory tract, terminating in layer Ia. It also receives inputs from the anterior olfactory nucleus, other olfactory cortical regions, and commissural fibers from the contralateral piriform cortex via the anterior commissure [3]. Efferent projections target the orbitofrontal cortex, amygdala (especially basolateral and anterior cortical nuclei), entorhinal cortex, mediodorsal thalamus, hypothalamus, and contralateral piriform cortex. Feedback projections to the olfactory bulb terminate on GABAergic granule cell interneurons [3]. Neuromodulatory inputs include acetylcholine from the horizontal limb of the diagonal band, norepinephrine from the locus coeruleus, serotonin from the raphe nucleus, and dopamine from the ventral tegmental area [3]. The piriform cortex also features an extensive intracortical association fiber system, forming an auto-associative network that supports distributed processing [3].
臨床的意義: The human Piriform Cortex is highly epileptogenic, particularly in rodents, and can be the site of seizure onset in systemic chemoconvulsant models [6]. It is involved in the onset and propagation of temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) [4]. Functional connectivity abnormalities localize to the piriform cortex even when seizures arise from remote brain areas [14]. One source mentioned damage to this area could result in difficulties with hearing and understanding speech [2], but this contradicts the primary evidence linking it to olfaction.

Subject: BA52
